result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • James D. Howen II was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Bond on file to be applied to fine/costs.
*Payment Plan:  $50/month, commencing in April.
*Court grants motion to reduce the fine by the cost of the assessment and driver safety plan.  Defendant has 7 days to provide the receipt to the Clerk of Courts Office.
*Granted Huber after the first 48 hours.  *Sentence to commence forthwith.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: for Ignition Interlock Exemption s/ROW/9-8-16

Defendant James D. Howen in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wishes to continue today without counsel.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds waiver of counsel made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Court has reviewed the letter filed by defendant requesting modification of the JOC.  Defendant states his motion.  Atty Hendee opposes the motion.
BY THE COURT:  Court appreciates the filing of the motion; however, Court cannot grant the request at this time.  Motion denied.
Associated with Charge #1
request for House Arrest
Motion hearing at 06-03-2015 09:30 am
MOTION TO REDUCE FINE BY COST OF ASSESSMENT AND DRIVER SAFETY PLAN PAID W/ORDER
Motion and Order to Reduce Fine by Cost of Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Paid s/BNB/3-5-15

Defendant James D. Howen in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14TR944 tracking with:
Atty Hendee files an amended information with the court changing Ct. 1 to OWI - 3rd offense, removing the enhancer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  14TR944 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.    Defendant received a copy of the amended information and waives it's reading.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to that amended charge.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  
Ct. 2 along with 14TR944 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court order 180 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report Forthwith
*Defendant will be held without huber for the first 48 hours*
Pay fine and costs = $1,820.00
36 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Credit = 2 days
bond to be applied
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in April
Court will grant the motion to reduce fine by cost of assessment and driver safety plan paid.  Court gives 7 days to provide the receipt.

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
14TR944 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James D. Howen in court with attorney Peter Middleton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic ticket tracking with:
Atty Hendee states that in talking with Atty Gumz earlier; the parties are requesting a reset.
Atty Middleton agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Jury trial on December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James D. Howen in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Brian Noll called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee.  Record to reflect witness identified the defendant.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Cross-examined by Atty Gumz.  State submits traffic record.  State rests.  Atty Gumz stipulates to the traffic record for purposes of this hearing.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.
Atty Hendee requests the Court find probable cause.  Atty Gumz objects to bind-over.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Jury trial scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James D. Howen in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic ticket tracking with.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz requests Prelim and waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Preliminary Hearing; time limits waived.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
14TR944 is set to track w/14CF46 per DA's Office

Defendant James D. Howen by video, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $250 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
